description: a(n) is the number of ways to write n in bases 2-10 such that the digit k-1 appears in the representation in base k.
prog: (PARI) a(n) =  {nb = 0; for (b=2, 10, if (n, digs = digits(n, b), digs = [0]); for (i=1, #digs, if (digs[i] == b-1, nb++; break;););); return (nb);}\\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 14 2013
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_
extensions: Additional comments from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Mar 16 2001
